dmca.title: Buzzle.com abuzz over copying claims
dmca.body:
================================ = = = = = =
Proofs of http://www.isarticle.com scrapping from http://www.buzzle.com
================================ = = = = = =
 

isarticle.com has been copying articles from buzzle.com since last 2-3 months. Till now they have copied most of our articles, and our new articles consistently get added to their site. Out of 21 categories on isarticle.com, 18 categories are exact copy of ours. (Remaining 3 categories copy another site in a similar way our content is copied.)
 

Below are some proofs that http://www.isarticle.com is scrapping http://www.buzzle.com
 

Proof 1:
On August 7, 2006 we added HTML comments to our articles. The HTML comment contains pageview data in the following format:
<!--
Your pageview was recorded by Buzzle.com as follows:
URL accessed:
HTTP_USER_AGENT: 
REMOTE_ADDR:
REMOTE_HOST:
HTTP_REFERER: 
-->
<!-- Copyright Buzzle.com -->
 

These comments then started appearing in new articles on isarticle.com with the actual data, for e.g.:
<!--
<br />Your pageview was recorded by Buzzle.com as follows:
<br />URL accessed:
www.buzzle.com/editorials/8-7-2006-104792.asp
<br />HTTP_USER_AGENT:
<br />REMOTE_ADDR: 205.209.163.26
<br />REMOTE_HOST: 205.209.163.26
<br />HTTP_REFERER:
<br />-->
<br />
<br /><!-- Copyright Buzzle.com -->
 

This prooves that isarticle.com is using a crawler to get our content. Their crawler is run from 205.209.163.26 and shows empty User Agent.
 

The comments may not stay long on isarticle.com so we have taken snapshots of the article and viewsource. The attached snapshots were taken for following urls (in front of each isarticle url we have provided our url to verify that same content and comments do exist on Buzzle):

Proof 2:
Google search for
site:www.isarticle.com buzzle 
reveals several references to buzzle.com.
 

Proof 3:
Our paid authors have been sending disclaimers that they did not submit content on isarticle.com and are not sure how their articles are appearing on that site.
For e.g. Buzzle.com pays Sonal Panse ( http://www.buzzle.com/authors.asp?author=762) for writing articles to publish on buzzle.com. A Google search for site:www.isarticle.com sonal panse shows that all her articles on Buzzle.com are also on isarticle.com. Sonal quickly sent a disclaimer when she noticed this, that she did not provide the articles to isarticle.com.
 

Above is just one example. All our paid authors' articles have been copied by isarticle.com.
 

Proof 4:
18 of isarticle.com's categories are named same as buzzle.com. The category name "History & the Human Experience" is typical of Buzzle.com for years. We do not claim copyright for category names, but this point is just to provide additional hints.
 

Proof 5 :
Author names used in isarticle are exactly same as ours, while they show no author name for articles where we use "Buzzle staff" as author name.
 

Proof 6 :
Article meta description of isarticle.com is exactly same as that of buzzle.com. It is important to note that article descriptions displayed on isarticle.com pages are meta descriptions of our articles. That's why there may be slight difference between descriptions actually displayed on the article page by buzzle.com and isarticle.com.
 

================================
More info on 
http://www.isarticle.com
================================
Below info is just to provide additional hints to find the parent scraper network:
 

isarticle.com had been displaying Adsense ads, but seems they removed the ads now. The ads can be seen if you do a Google search for
allinurl:article -print site:isarticle.com
and click on 'Cached'. Their ad code includes following line:
google_ad_client = "pub-9058490403425989";
 

isarticle.com site seems to be hosted in China, but their crawler IP address is located in Fremont, CA. (This info is based on IP Lookup).
 

Domain lookup for isarticle.com shows following info:
Creation Date: 28-apr-2006
Expiration Date: 28-apr-2007
 

So it is just over 3 months that the site came into existance, and the domain is registered for only 1 year. Page Rank of http://www.isarticle.com/ homepage is 5 as shown by Google Toolbar.

Supporting screenshots have been sent to removals@google.com as they could not be included with the fax.

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law."

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.
